Electric Motors¶

Available Electric Motors:

  • Permanently Excited DC Motor
  • Externally Excited DC Motor
  • DC Series Motor
  • DC Shunt Motor
  • Permanent Magnet Synchronous Motor
  • Synchronous Reluctance Motor
  • Base DC Motor
  • Synchronous Base Motor

Electric Motor Base Class¶

class gym_electric_motor.physical_systems.electric_motors.ElectricMotor(motor_parameter=None, nominal_values=None, limit_values=None, **__)[source]¶

Base class for all technical electrical motor models.

A motor consists of the ode-state. These are the dynamic quantities of its ODE. For example:

ODE-State of a DC-shunt motor: `` [i_a, i_e ] ``
  • i_a: Anchor circuit current
  • i_e: Exciting circuit current

Each electric motor can be parametrized by a dictionary of motor parameters, the nominal state dictionary and the limit dictionary.

Parameters:
  • motor_parameter – Motor parameter dictionary. Contents specified for each motor.
  • nominal_values – Nominal values for the motor quantities.
  • limit_values – Limits for the motor quantities.
CURRENTS = []¶

CURRENTS(list(str)) – List of the motor currents names

CURRENTS_IDX = []¶

CURRENTS_IDX(list(int)) – Indices for accessing all motor currents.

VOLTAGES = []¶

VOLTAGES(list(str)) – List of the motor input voltages names

electrical_ode(currents, u_in, omega, *_)[source]¶

Calculation of the derivatives of each motor state variable for the given inputs / The motors ODE-System.

Parameters:
  • currents (ndarray(float)) – The motors state.
  • u_in (list(float)) – The motors input voltages.
  • omega (float) – Angular velocity of the motor
Returns:

Derivatives of the motors ODE-system for the given inputs.
Return type:

ndarray(float)
i_in(state)[source]¶
Parameters:state (ndarray(float)) – ODE state of the motor
Returns:List of all currents flowing into the motor.
Return type:list(float)
limits¶

Readonly motors limit state array. Entries are set to the maximum physical possible values in case of unspecified limits.

Returns:Limits of the motor.
Return type:dict(float)
motor_parameter¶

**Returns* – dict(float)* – The motors parameter dictionary

nominal_values¶

Readonly motors nominal values.

Returns:Current nominal values of the motor.
Return type:dict(float)
reset()[source]¶

Reset the motors state to a new initial state. (Default 0)

Returns:The initial motors state.
Return type:numpy.ndarray(float)
torque(currents)[source]¶

Torque equation of the motor.

Parameters:currents (numpy.ndarray(float)) – Motor currents to calculate the Torque.
Returns:Motor torque for the given state.
Return type:float
